    About Me

    Hi there! I am Shamim, a tenure-track Assistant Professor of Software Engineering in the College of Computing and Software Engineering (CSSE) at Kennesaw State University. I earned my PhD in Computer Science and Software Engineering from Auburn University under the supervision of Dr. Akond Rahman. Prior to that, I completed my bachelors degree in Computer Science and Engineering at the Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology (BUET). My research lies in software engineering with a strong focus on open-source and cloud-native security, particularly in the context of DevOps, secure software development, and software supply-chain resilience. I study how security vulnerabilities emerge from misconfiguration, automation pipelines, and dependency management in modern open-source ecosystems, and I develop practitioner-oriented solutions to mitigate these risks. Previously, I received the Bronze Award in the ACM Student Research Competition at FSE 2021 in the graduate category.

    Currently I am looking for a PhD student to join in my research group from Fall 2026.
